content: bat finished size approx 13cm/ 5in tall yarn a small amount 4-ply/ fingering yarn in light brown yarn b small amount mohair/ lace-weight fuzzy yarn in brown ii used a - drops alpaca in light brown- shade no 0607 b - drops kid-silk in chocolate - shade no 35 knitting needles pair size 2mm/ us straight knitting needles 0 gauge 12 5 row and 11 stitches over 2 5cm with 2mm needles and 4-ply yarn extras pair 7 5mm or 7mm black glue-in eyes you can use toy safety eyes with backings if you like but look out for the notes in the patterns regarding these fabric glue i used strong stick glue similar to pritt stick toy filling for small items you ll only need a tiny bit of regular toy filling or just use scrap yarn 10 x locking type stitch markers see colour guide on page 2 safety pin for holding stitches when not in use scissors and yarn-sewing needle dark coloured thread and white coloured thread light-brown felt measuring no less than 26cm/ 11in x 12cm/ 5in and no more than 1mm thick plus sewing thread to match i bought my eyes from here - celloexpress and my felt from here - handmadeonly etsy ©claire garland bat page 2 bat page 3 coloured marker guide special instructions this guide is here to pull out and use together with the pattern should w+tk bring working yarn to the front of the work slip next stitch p-wise onto the to wish to use similar coloured guides to mine for ease of following rh needle take working yarn to the back slip the slipped stitch back onto the lh especially at the making-up stage needle turn the knitting = w+tk wrap and turn knit head & body w+tp take working yarn to the back of the work slip next stitch knit-wise onto the pink muzzle rh needle bring working yarn to the front slip the slipped stitch back onto the lh yellow neck needle turn the knitting = w+tp wrap and turn purl green foreleg placement general abbreviations blue hind leg k = knit orange belly p = purl *pattern note increase = increase i was in a conundrum as to whether to stay true-ish to the bat anatomy and have only bat wings or to go down the cute avenue decrease = decrease and add forelegs - so i ve written the pattern for both k2tog/ k3tog = knit two together/ knit three together if you want forelegs simply continue to work through the pattern to the end of page 27 or if you don t omit the forelegs p2tog/ p3tog = purl two together/ purl three together section and work the continuation of the wings on pages 28/29 rh/lh = right hand/ left hand rs/ws = right side/ wrong side - you can of course have both st/ sts =stitch/ stitches skpo = slip one stitch knit next stitch pass slipped stitch over knit stitch to decrease
